data.title: Henri of Lorraine, 3rd Duke of Guise
data.text:
Henri of Lorraine of Lorraine, 3rd Duke of Guise (31 December 1550 – 23 December 1588) was the eldest son of Francis, Duke of Guise, and Anna d'Este. His maternal grandparents were Ercole II d'Este, Duke of Ferrara, and Renée of France. Through his maternal grandfather, he was a descendant of Lucrezia Borgia and Pope Alexander VI. A key figure in the French Wars of Religion, he was one of the namesakes of the War of the Three Henrys. A powerful opponent of the queen mother, Catherine de' Medici, Henry was assassinated by the bodyguards of her son, King Henry III.

Marriage[edit]

On 4 October 1570 in Paris to Catherine of Cleves (1548–1633), Countess of Eu. They had fourteen children.

Issue[edit]

Charles of Lorraine, 4th Duke of Guise (20 August 1571 – 30 September 1640) married Henriette Catherine de Joyeuse and had issue. who succeeded him.

Henri of Lorraine (30 June 1572 – 3 August 1574)

Catherine of Lorraine (3 November 1573) (died at birth)

Louis of Lorraine, Cardinal de Lorraine (1575–1621) Archbishop of Reims.

Charles of Lorraine (1 January 1576) died at birth.

Marie of Lorraine (1 June 1577 – 1582)

Claude of Lorraine, Duke of Chevreuse (1578–1657) married Marie de Rohan and had issue.

Catherine of Lorraine (born 29 May 1579) died young

Christine of Lorraine (21 January 1580) died at birth.

François of Lorraine (14 May 1581 – 29 September 1582)

Renée of Lorraine (1585 – 13 June 1626) Abbess of Saint Pierre.

Jeanne of Lorraine (31 July 1586 – 8 October 1638) Abbess of Jouarre.

Louise Marguerite of Lorraine (1588 – 30 April 1631) married François, Prince of Conti but had no issue.

François Alexandre of Lorraine (7 February 1589 – 1 June 1614)
